channel.title: Client loads user and pass when opened
channel.description: So i have the deathlypvpz v3 client and everytime it is opened my username and password is saved into it. If i were to release this it will be thre for anyone to log into. How to I make it that it either doesnt save the name and password or clear out the data so it will save the next persons account

item.title: Client loads user and pass when opened
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“xX4m4zingXx, post:3, topic:526844”]i think it saves in the cache
in my cache it has a file named: saveuser.ini
go into a file that looks something like this ^
and then search the username and pass and then empty it
then make a package from the cache and upload it so it will be
empty when you first play your server[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Client loads user and pass when opened

item.title: Client loads user and pass when opened
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

Deathlypvp loads your pass and name to cache txt file to keep them recorded. (You can check it by going in cache and read the .txt file)
Delete the way how it saves it there and you are good to go.

Read full topic
item.source: Client loads user and pass when opened
